divs: sighting detailsi saw the object flying fairly low over interstate 65 while driving my truck through louisville, ky between 2:15-2:30 am friday the 3rd of feb. i was heading southbound about 2-1\2 miles south of the big bridge coming in from indiana. the object was about 700-1000 feet in the air, moving fairly slowly, and was moving southbound just east of the interstate. as it was traveling it was also drifting from east to west. i was actually able to keep up with it at approximately 55mph. at first i thought it was a small plane, but rolled down my window and heard no noise other then the other traffic. also, there were lights (will make an ascii sketch below) at the tips\ends? of the object that changed from red to white in colour, but alternating, (when one end was red, the other was white). in-between the ends of the object was a sequence of lights that chased from left to right, then from the middle to the ends, then from right to left and repeated again, i have no idea what the shape of the object was as it was dark out, but estimating from the height and distance from where i was driving and as it was moving back and forth across the interstate as i paced it, i would have to say that it was most likely 80-100 feet in size. here is the pattern of lights that i saw: * ||||||| * the asterisks are the end lights that were alternating from red to white, almost like the lights on a squad car, and the bars are the ones that acted almost like chasers, those lights were red in colour) i saw this object for about 5 minutes or so, then it just faded, it did not head off in a direction, or zoom off, it simply faded. i should add that it did appear to be maintaining it's altitude, neither going up or down, just heading south and slowly moving to and fro across interstate.
trends: There have been 67 other sightings in Louisville
There were no other sightings in Louisville on or around February 3rd 2012
Summary: Object seen with blinking lights on corners/ends that alternated colour, sequence of lights between ends, slowly zig-zagging across interstate 65
